title: Manchester derby buildup, WSL news and a Championship grudge match – matchday live
summary: Stay updated with the latest happenings in European football as a busy day unfolds. Key matches and player movements are making headlines across the continent. Don't miss the exciting developments in leagues and teams!

title: World Athletics Championships 2025: 100m finals, men’s 10,000m and more – live
summary: Daniel Harris will report live from Tokyo, covering an exciting evening filled with medal events. Stay tuned for updates and highlights from the competitions. Don't miss the latest developments from this thrilling sports scene.

title: I used to embrace my manic episodes – until a therapist’s advice set me straight, and out on a butterfly hunt | Claire Jackson
summary: Journalist Claire Jackson expresses the desire for balance in her life, finding the highs preferable to the lows. She reflects on the need to avoid extremes and considers reconnecting with a childhood passion for support. This pursuit may serve as a remedy for her emotional fluctuations.

title: A sprint finish and disbelieving bronze: women’s marathon brings worlds thrills
summary: Julia Paternain, ranked 288th in the world for marathon running, made history by winning Uruguay's first-ever bronze medal at a World Athletics Championship. Her achievement marks a significant milestone for Uruguayan athletics. The victory highlights Paternain's remarkable performance on the global stage.

title: Immigration law firm making £1.7m in legal aid loses contract over standards
summary: Thousands of asylum seekers are facing legal uncertainty after a firm took on a vast number of cases, relying on only five solicitors to handle them. This significant mismatch in resources has left many without adequate legal representation. The situation raises concerns about the fairness and efficacy of the asylum process.
